website_summaries.verdict: A mighty tool that delivers professional grade power for accomplishing numerous construction and building tasks.
pros: The brushless motor is designed to last and the wear-resistant, responsive trigger provides precision control while working
The built-in LED light comes in handy, but the second battery allows you to increase your work time
cons: The drill, itself, is durable, but there can be issues with the batteries and/or charger

customer_reviews.title: Best battery powered hand tools I have ever owned.
customer_reviews.text: Hitachi powered hand tools (corded and not) were the primary tools I used to build my current house and they were up to the challenge....every single one of them. As a result of that experience, I bought this cordless drill driver recently when my old, large, and heavy as hell 19V Craftsman was something I just didn't want to use any more. It uses the same 18V Li battery as my impact driver that I have had and beat the hell out of since 2013. This driver rocks just like my impact driver and it is small, lightweight, and torquey as all getout. Great quality and performance
customer_reviews.author: MechEng

customer_reviews.title: Unbeatable at the price with minor issues
customer_reviews.text: Great Drill, but the light doesn't end up doing what you want it to and the batteries seem to drain faster than you may expect. However, the batteries charge quickly and, at the end of the day, the drill's performance is unbeatable for the cost.

customer_reviews.title: Love it! (Two years later)
customer_reviews.text: I have had this over two years now. I use it for hours a day, 5 days a week, coring 5/8 and 7/8 inch coaxial hard-line, which needs much more power than just drilling. Great tool. never lets me down. If you will use it regularly, don't bother getting one that comes with batteries. Get 3.0 Ah batteries instead. You will be glad you did. They last so much longer.

customer_reviews.title: Read the warranty fine print
customer_reviews.text: The drill is OK so far, but take a good look at the "lifetime warranty." It defines "lifetime" as the time until all parts are no longer available for the tool. So, in fact, the lifetime warranty ends anytime they say it ends. Could be next year or could be next week. The true warranty is the period in which the store you bought it from will still take it back and refund your money. I really hate deceptive stuff like this.
customer_reviews.author: Raven

product_meta.title: Hitachi DS18DBFL2 18V Cordless Lithium Ion Brushless Driver Drill (Includes Two 1.5Ah Batteries)
product_meta.description: Covered by Hitachi's Lifetime Lithium Ion tool warranty, the DS18DBFL2 Driver Drill features Hitachi's Brushless motor technology that delivers more power to the motor by minimizing unnecessary energy loss through friction and heat. Managed by a micro-processor chip that efficiently delivers current flow to the motor, Brushless tools experience longer run time between charges, increased power, and extended durability with essentially no maintenance. Hitachi's signature ergonomic design for the tool body makes it extremely well-balanced and comfortable for extended use. It is an ideal driver drill for drilling into wood, plastic, mild steel and aluminum, plus its 22+1 stage clutch with 22 torque settings and a drill mode allow for precision and control based on the application.
feature_bullets: Hitachi Power Tools has renamed to Metabo HPT. Same great tools, with only a new name.
Brushless Motor Technology for higher efficiency, increased run time and longer tool life
Professional grade power with 620 inches/pounds of turning torque and up to 1,800 RPM
Powered by Hitachi's 18V Lithium Ion slide type batteries for fade free power and lighter weight than NiCd batteries
Ratcheting 1/2 inches keyless all metal chuck for quick and simple bit replacements and secure holding power
22 stage + 1 clutch settings delivers 22 torque settings and a drill mode for ultimate precision and control
Optical trigger switch for a more responsive variable speed actuation, and wear resistant trigger assembly
Built in LED light effectively illuminates dark work spaces
On tool battery indicator displays the amount of power remaining in the battery pack to avoid downtime
Metal belt hook so the tool is always close at hand
